name: Meriton Serviced Apartments Pitt Street

reviews.text: We booked a 2 bedroom apartment with a skyview (well worth the extra $20 for skyview) & were pleasantly surprised by the wonderful view from the 43rd floor. The units are very spacious with TV & ensuite in the main bedroom, TV- lounge-dining area as well as a washing machine & dryer beside the full kitchen. We had a small problem of a leaking dishwasher & contacted reception & within 5 minutes the maintenence man was there to fix the problem. Excellent location with Woolworths just around the corner for all your food supplies. We caught the airtrain from the airport to Town Hall Station and the Hotel is just around the corner, no more than 150m to walk. We had 4 adults staying & it never felt crowded. It's a real bonus to be able to do your washing in the comfort of your own unit and not have to worry about coins or the dramas of a laundromat.The units were a little noisier than I thought they'd be even with the windows & doors all closed up and with the air conditioner on you could still hear sirens going all night, the second night didn't seem as bad. The other small issue was with the air con, it is set to only run 4hrs at a time, so who ever got up to the bathroom first in the night had to turn it back on again. But both these issues were minimal compared to the great value & service at the Hotel. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay & would gladly return.
reviews.title: Sensational Great Value Hotel in a convenient location

reviews.text: I stayed here with my adult daughter for 3 days. The apartment was on the 65th floor and had amazing views across Sydney. It was incredibly spacious and well equipped with a superb main bathroom. The kitchen had everything you could wish for from dishwasher to washing machine and tumble drier. The staff on reception were helpful. It has to be said that it is pricey, but as in all things, you get what you pay for and for a once in a lifetime trip to Sydney it fitted the bill perfectly.
reviews.title: The way to stay in Sydney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being 2 couples we wanted a serviced apartment with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms - picked the Meriton based on past reviews. We were on 44th floor overlooking Darling Harbour, but also the air conditioning unit on the neighbouring bulding so asked for a change - given choice of 2 but both on lower floors and considerable darker than ours,. Stayed where we were - apartment well- equipped and comfortable. Location excellent for getting round Sydney. Only downside was cleaning - we realise this was a serviced apartment and not subject to the full cleaning expected in a hotel but after 4 days we had to ask for the floor to be vacuumed. We also needed the iron to be changed. Every time we asked for anything at reception it was delivered or sorted at once - staff always very helpful and friendly
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: I stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment at the Meriton on Pitt St. with 5 girlfriends, and we all loved the apartment. It worked out to be very reasonably priced considering the apartment. It is in the perfect location. It's walking distance to everything we wanted- sights, restaraunts, shops, clubs, supermarket close by, 7/11 very close, etc.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Great Place, Excellent Location, Fantastic Value
reviews.text: The room was amazing. Great views, very spacious, good furniture, well set out with the main bedroom being close to the kitchen, lounge and dining area with the other 2 bedrooms down the other end of the apartment.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 7 nights in January in a one-bedroom apartment. The apartment itself was fairly roomy and had everything we needed. However, there was definitely no 'wow factor' although perhaps that is reflected in the very reasonable price. We found that although the apartment was serviced daily, it was really just making the bed and changing of towels rather than cleaning.
reviews.title: Good value apartment
Mertion Pitt Street
reviews.text: As it our first time in Sydney, we found that most days we wanted to be down at the Rocks/Circular Quay area at some point - whether it was to catch a ferry somewhere or to have dinner. This is about a 20-25 minute walk from the hotel, and we would definitely stay nearer Circular Quay next time we go to Sydney. However, not everyone who goes to Sydney would spend as much time as we did down at the harbourside, so maybe not a problem for others. It was near Town Hall station and plenty of shops to get any groceries.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read all about the lifts, we were slightly concerned, but we never had any problems with them.
reviews.title: Excellent self contained apartments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice apparments. I was lucky enough to get a tv in my lounge and bedroom. The one bedroom apparments are on the lower levels, so not as many views. Only a short walk from "town hall' sation and Woolworth store.
reviews.title: The pits on Pitt Street!!!
More than adequate excellent location
reviews.text: My fiance and I stayed at the Meriton Pitt Street from 28th December 2009 for 4 nights. Understandably rates were higher for the 2 nights closest to New Year, but in general the price for a 1 bedroom apartment was very good value.
Fantastic, thats all we can say
reviews.title: You couldn't ask for anything more
Excellent for our 3 nights in Sydney
reviews.text: Room service was great, staff friendly, clean, modern.

Superb 2 bed appt. Clean & everything worked and was as described. Very helpful reception. Ideal for sight seeing. I booked in May and got a very good deal for our stay in November. Secure accommodation with second to none facilities. One of the best accommodations we've had in a city by far. Would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: Unbelievable place to stay

reviews.text: We stayed here in July 2009. What a shock when on arrival the Manager stated we'd been upgraded from our 2 bed appt to the Penthouse suite on the 51st floor.
reviews.title: Excellent, stylish, and well located

reviews.text: Wow....talk about living like Royalty for the 3 nights we were there.
reviews.title: Love Loved Love!!! I could stay in for the whole day!!

reviews.text: This place is awesome in terms of location and apartment amenities. Let us start with the room, it is clean and so neatly arranged that you wonder if the chambermaid was a superwoman. Apartment is definitely big enough to accomodate my entourage of 5 adults and 1 baby. The beds were very comfortable and linen were clean. The first impression of the bathroom was almost of the Ritz-carlton standard (For those who were there, you will know what I mean). Views from the apartment were amazing overlooking the entire CBD area and parts of the Sydney Harbour Bridge. I was even impressed by the instant coffee they gave and they were definitely not of the Woolworths variety!
reviews.title: It was a regret that I stayed only 1 night....

reviews.text: Location of the apartment is great with minutes away from the monorail station. It is right smack in the middle of CBD and is within walking distance to Chinatown and QVB. Parking was a slight hassle since the entrance of the carpark was not Pitt St but Bathurst St. Nonetheless, parking spaces were ample. (One reminder for those driving out of the carpark: the reader to open the garage doors is located some distance down the ramp from the gates. So do not assume the reader is near the gates.
reviews.title: Number #1 in Sydney .. best place to stay with a family

reviews.text: Any gripes? A few. For a start the TV should be updated to the LCD variety rather than the CRT ones. The CRT ones kindof counter the contemporary image of the apartment. There wasn't a rubber plug to plug the bathtub thus I couldn't enjoy the jacuzzi tub. Reception staff was helpful but a tad cold (I guess to be expected of a Sydneyian?).
reviews.title: AWESOME HOLIDAY

reviews.text: All in all, I think this apartment is fabulous and it was definitely a regret that I could only stay 1 night. I highly recommend anybody who wants a wonderful stay without burning a huge hole in your pocket!
reviews.title: Centre of everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was great about this hotel. We stayed for 5 nights with 4 adults and 1 toddler. It was almost like being home. Apartments were huge, great views, clean. We did not encounter any waiting at the lifts as others described.
reviews.title: Great value

aka: Meriton Serviced Apartments Pitt Street Hotel
description: Boasting 178 spacious apartments of impressive space and design in a variety of studio, one, two and three bedroom configurations. Located on the corner of Pitt and Bathurst Streets the property occupies a central position in the heart of Sydney. Conveniently within walking distance to most business including the financial precinct of Martin Place. Also only moments to Hyde Park, State Theatre, Darling Harbour, World Square and Chinatown. The world famous Queen Victoria Building is just around the corner and is full of inspired shopping and eating options. A short stroll down Pitt Street and you'll find The Galleries Victoria, Strand Arcade, Myer, David Jones, Mid City, Westfield Shopping Centre and Castlereagh Street where the best designer brand boutiques await. An array of dining experiences and entertainment options are close-by, so you can enjoy all the cosmopolitan life that Sydney has to offer. Exploring Sydney is easy with so many ways to get around town including buses, ferries, trains, Monorail and Light Rail systems. The Monorail travels past this great location, down Pitt Street then around to Darling Harbour. A variety of local restaurants are able to deliver meals directly to your apartment door or within the same block of the property is a large Woolworths Supermarket for all your grocery needs. Luxurious spacious apartments have a kitchen (studios have kitchenettes), and a separate laundry, which includes clothes washer, dryer, iron and ironing board. The apartments are also fully air-conditioned and most have opening windows and balconies to allow for fresh air - although balcony doors are locked on Fridays, Saturdays and Public Holidays, due to our improved safety policy. The registered guest of the apartment is legally responsible and liable for all damage/harm caused by any object leaving the apartment.
